title: Top 10 Beaches on Costa Blanca South: The Complete Guide
excerpt: Discover the best beaches on Costa Blanca South, from the Blue Flag-awarded shores of Torrevieja and Orihuela Costa to the protected dunes of Guardamar del Segura. Our complete guide covers everything you need to know about these stunning Mediterranean coastlines.
author: New Build Homes Costa Blanca

content.quickAnswer: Costa Blanca South boasts over 50 kilometers of stunning Mediterranean coastline with some of Spain's finest Blue Flag beaches. The top beaches include La Mata and Los Locos in Torrevieja, La Zenia and Cabo Roig in Orihuela Costa, the pristine dunes of Guardamar del Segura, and the charming shores of Pilar de la Horadada. Most offer excellent facilities, safe swimming conditions, and vibrant beachfront communities perfect for families and water sports enthusiasts.
content.intro: Costa Blanca South, stretching across the southern reaches of Alicante Province, is home to some of the Mediterranean's most beautiful and well-maintained beaches. With an impressive 86 Blue Flag awards across the region in 2024 (the most of any Spanish province), these beaches consistently meet the highest international standards for water quality, facilities, and environmental management. Whether you're seeking family-friendly sandy shores, dramatic dune landscapes, or vibrant beach resort atmospheres, Costa Blanca South delivers world-class coastal experiences. This guide explores the top 10 beaches that make this region a must-visit destination, with practical information on facilities, nearby developments, and what makes each beach special.

sections.name: La Mata Beach, Torrevieja
sections.description: La Mata is the jewel of Torrevieja's coastline, stretching for an impressive 2.5 kilometers along the town center. This extensive sandy beach features golden sand and crystal-clear waters, backed by a vibrant palm-lined promenade with numerous restaurants, bars, and shops. Blue Flag certified, La Mata beach is meticulously maintained with nightly cleaning during peak season. The beach features excellent facilities including lifeguards, showers, sun lounger rentals, and a charming children's play area. The long stretch provides ample space for both swimmers and sunbathers. Nearby residential developments include modern apartments and villas throughout central Torrevieja, making this beach highly accessible to property owners and vacationers. The combination of its generous length, sophisticated amenities, and vibrant atmosphere makes La Mata the premier choice for those seeking a lively beach experience with all conveniences.
sections.highlights: Longest beach in Torrevieja, palm-lined promenade, vibrant nightlife and dining

sections.name: Los Locos Beach, Torrevieja
sections.description: Los Locos is one of Torrevieja's most popular beaches, earning its name (The Crazy Ones) from its energetic atmosphere and outstanding facilities for water sports. This Blue Flag beach extends along a scenic promenade lined with excellent restaurants and bars, offering everything from casual beachside dining to upscale cuisine. The beach provides a comprehensive range of water activities including windsurfing, paragliding, water tubes, and jet skis. Sandy and well-maintained, Los Locos attracts families, young professionals, and water sports enthusiasts. The beach features dedicated lifeguard stations, clean facilities, and professional water safety management. Its central location near numerous beachfront apartments and tourist amenities makes it ideal for both tourists and residents. The exceptional variety of activities and services combined with reliable beach conditions make Los Locos perfect for those seeking an active, entertainment-filled beach day.
facilities: Water sports rentals (windsurfing, paragliding, water tubes)
sections.highlights: Premier water sports destination, extensive amenities, vibrant beach culture

sections.name: El Cura Beach, Torrevieja
sections.description: El Cura occupies a special place in Torrevieja's beach landscape, earning Blue Flag status for its exceptional water quality and comprehensive family-oriented facilities. Located in the very heart of Torrevieja, this beach is ideal for families with young children due to its calm waters and extensive support services. The charming children's play area attracts families year-round, while abundant restaurants and bars line the seafront promenade. El Cura features modern facilities including clean toilets, showers, and professional lifeguard coverage throughout summer months. The beach's protected location within the town ensures excellent accessibility and proximity to shopping, services, and accommodation. The calm waters make it perfect for swimming lessons and family activities. The combination of family-friendly atmosphere, calm waters, and comprehensive facilities make El Cura an outstanding choice for those prioritizing safety and children's entertainment.
sections.highlights: Family-friendly atmosphere, calm waters, excellent children's facilities

sections.name: Los Náufragos Beach, Torrevieja
sections.description: Los Náufragos (The Shipwrecked) offers a more relaxed alternative to Torrevieja's busier beaches while maintaining Blue Flag standards. This attractive beach stretches along a palm-lined promenade with excellent restaurants and bars providing authentic local dining experiences. The sandy beach provides good sun-bathing conditions with moderate summer waves suitable for casual swimmers. Los Náufragos maintains professional lifeguard services, clean facilities, and shower stations. The beach's location slightly south of central Torrevieja makes it ideal for those seeking a quieter experience while still accessing top-tier facilities and amenities. Well-maintained parking areas ensure convenient access even during peak season. The relaxed yet professionally-managed atmosphere, combined with high water quality standards and excellent dining options, make Los Náufragos perfect for those seeking quality without excessive crowds.
sections.highlights: Blue Flag status, quieter than Los Locos, excellent local restaurants

sections.name: El Moncayo Beach, Guardamar del Segura
sections.description: El Moncayo is a pristine natural gem stretching approximately 1,500 meters along the Guardamar coastline, renowned for its protected sand dune ecosystem. The beach features distinctive natural dunes forming part of the Las Dunas de Guardamar regeneration project, which has replanted native species to preserve this delicate coastal environment. The sandy beach extends about 30 meters wide at the waterline, offering excellent swimming in clear Mediterranean waters. El Moncayo provides essential facilities including two lifeguard stations, Red Cross coverage, fresh water showers, sun lounger rentals, and clean toilets. Summer beach bars offer refreshments and light meals. The beach boasts ample free parking during off-peak times, though early arrival is recommended during July and August. The combination of natural beauty, protected dunes, and sustainable environmental practices make El Moncayo ideal for those appreciating unspoiled coastal landscapes and ecological conservation.
sections.highlights: Protected dune ecosystem, natural environment, free parking, peaceful setting

sections.name: La Zenia Beach, Orihuela Costa
sections.description: La Zenia is one of the most popular and vibrant beaches along Orihuela Costa, attracting both tourists and local residents with its excellent facilities and lively atmosphere. The large sandy beach features shallow waters ideal for families and swimmers of all abilities. This Blue Flag-certified beach provides comprehensive facilities including professional lifeguards during summer months, dedicated disabled access pathways, ample parking areas, convenient bus stops for public transport access, and a dedicated play area for children. A popular beach bar operates in the central area, offering shaded dining and refreshments. The shallow, calm water combined with extensive safety measures makes La Zenia particularly suitable for families with young children. The beach's reputation for cleanliness and consistent maintenance reflects high environmental standards. Located near numerous beachfront restaurants and shops, La Zenia offers an all-encompassing beach experience with excellent nearby residential developments including modern apartments and villas perfect for property investment.
sections.highlights: Shallow calm waters, family-friendly, extensive amenities, popular beach bar

sections.name: Cabo Roig Beach, Orihuela Costa
sections.description: Cabo Roig Beach is a distinctive 420-meter stretch of pristine sandy beach characterized by its dramatic clifftop setting and picturesque harbor backdrop. The beach measures approximately 18 meters wide and is surrounded by beautiful coves creating a scenic coastal panorama. The iconic 16th-century Water Tower perches on the cliff above, adding historical character to this Mediterranean setting. Cabo Roig Marina features over 200 mooring spaces with a waterfront restaurant offering excellent dining with sea views. A beach bar with live music performances on Sunday afternoons provides entertainment and refreshment. The protected cove location ensures calm waters suitable for families and swimmers. Well-maintained sandy beach with professional management, the beach attracts those seeking a more exclusive, quieter experience than larger regional beaches. The combination of historical architecture, upscale dining, and scenic beauty make Cabo Roig ideal for those valuing quality, culture, and natural beauty.
sections.highlights: Historic Water Tower, upscale dining, scenic cove setting, Sunday live music

sections.name: Punta Prima Beach, Orihuela Costa
sections.description: Punta Prima is a compact Blue Flag beach extending over 200 meters with a distinctly exclusive atmosphere. The beach features white and golden sand providing an inviting setting for swimmers and sunbathers. Punta Prima's accessibility is exemplary, featuring a modern lift system for people with reduced mobility, ensuring wheelchair-accessible beach access. The beach provides all necessary facilities including professional showers, dedicated foot washing stations, staffed lifeguard stations, ample parking, convenient bus stop access, and a small beachfront restaurant. The modest size creates an intimate, less crowded atmosphere compared to larger regional beaches. Water quality maintenance reflects high environmental standards consistent with Blue Flag certification. The combination of excellent disabled access, quality facilities, and intimate setting makes Punta Prima particularly suitable for seniors, disabled visitors, and those seeking a quieter beach experience with exceptional amenities.
sections.highlights: Excellent disabled access with lift, intimate setting, quality facilities

sections.name: Mil Palmeras Beach, Pilar de la Horadada
sections.description: Mil Palmeras is a marvelous long sandy beach representing the highlights of Pilar de la Horadada's 4+ kilometers of coastline. The beach is characterized by extensive sandy shores, clear Mediterranean waters, and excellent facility provision. Mil Palmeras features comprehensive services including special disabled facilities during summer months, designated children's zones with play equipment, sun bed and umbrella rentals, and equipment hire for water activities (pedalos and kayaks). Numerous restaurants and cafés are positioned along the seafront, offering diverse dining options from casual beach fare to more formal cuisine. Evening summer markets feature local craft stalls operating until midnight, creating a lively cultural atmosphere. The beach maintains professional cleaning and maintenance standards. Well-designed infrastructure ensures comfortable day trips and extended stays. The combination of long sandy shores, excellent facilities, vibrant evening culture, and diverse dining make Mil Palmeras ideal for families seeking comprehensive beach experiences.
sections.highlights: Summer markets with craft stalls, pedalo and kayak rentals, vibrant evening culture

sections.name: Torre de la Horadada Beach, Pilar de la Horadada
sections.description: Torre de la Horadada represents the charming coastal extension of Pilar de la Horadada, centered around the historic old port town. This long sandy beach creates a natural cove formation providing calm, protected waters ideal for swimming. The beach has developed steadily with holiday homes and resort facilities while maintaining a distinctive low-rise architectural character absent from many Costa Blanca developments. The historic port adds cultural and authentic Spanish character to the beach experience. Wide sandy shores provide excellent sun-bathing and swimming conditions with summer lifeguard coverage ensuring safety. Facilities include foot washing stations, wooden beach access walkways accommodating all mobility levels, modern toilets, restaurants, and comprehensive equipment hire options. The Blue Flag designation (Playa de Rocamar and surrounding beaches) reflects consistent environmental and facility standards. The combination of historic port authenticity, calm protected waters, and sustainable low-rise development make Torre de la Horadada ideal for those seeking authentic Spanish coastal character.
sections.highlights: Historic port town character, calm cove setting, authentic Spanish atmosphere, low-rise development

content.conclusion:
Costa Blanca South's beaches represent some of the Mediterranean's finest coastal destinations, offering an impressive variety to suit every preference. From the vibrant, family-friendly atmosphere of Torrevieja's palm-lined shores to the pristine natural dunes of Guardamar, from the upscale resort experience of Orihuela Costa to the authentic Spanish charm of Pilar de la Horadada, this region delivers world-class beach experiences. The consistent Blue Flag certifications across numerous beaches reflect the region's commitment to environmental protection, water quality, and excellent facilities. Whether you're planning a vacation, considering a property investment in new build developments near these world-class beaches, or seeking the perfect retirement destination, Costa Blanca South's beaches provide the perfect backdrop for Mediterranean living. The extensive infrastructure, year-round mild climate, and thriving expatriate communities make these beaches not just vacation destinations but ideal locations for establishing a coastal lifestyle. Plan your visit or property exploration and discover why Costa Blanca South remains one of Europe's most sought-after coastal destinations.

faqs.question: Which are the best Blue Flag beaches near Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja boasts six Blue Flag beaches, with La Mata, Los Locos, El Cura, Los Náufragos, Cala de las Piteras, and Cabo Cervera leading the rankings. La Mata and Los Locos are particularly popular, offering vibrant atmospheres with extensive facilities, while El Cura is ideal for families with young children due to its calm waters and excellent safety provisions. All maintain the highest environmental standards consistent with Blue Flag certification.

faqs.question: What makes Guardamar del Segura beaches different from other Costa Blanca South options?
faqs.answer: Guardamar's beaches are distinguished by their protected sand dune ecosystems, which are actively managed as part of the Las Dunas de Guardamar regeneration project. The 11-kilometer stretch of golden sand includes El Moncayo as the centerpiece, offering a more natural, environmentally-conscious beach experience compared to the resort-style beaches elsewhere. The free parking and quieter atmosphere make it perfect for those seeking natural beauty and peaceful settings.

faqs.question: Are Orihuela Costa beaches suitable for families with young children?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. La Zenia, Punta Prima, and Cabo Roig are all excellent family destinations. La Zenia offers shallow, calm waters with dedicated children's play areas, while Punta Prima provides exemplary disabled access including beach lifts. All feature professional lifeguard coverage, clean facilities, and calm Mediterranean waters. The combination of safety features and amenities make Orihuela Costa beaches ideal for family vacations.

faqs.question: What water sports and activities are available at Costa Blanca South beaches?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja's Los Locos beach is renowned for water sports including windsurfing, paragliding, jet skis, and water tubes. Guardamar beaches offer more relaxed water activities. Pilar de la Horadada's Mil Palmeras and Torre de la Horadada provide pedalo and kayak rentals. Most beaches have lifeguard-supervised areas and equipment rental facilities. Water sports instructors and rental shops operate throughout the region.

faqs.question: When is the best time to visit Costa Blanca South beaches?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca South enjoys year-round mild climate. July-August offer warmest waters (25-26°C) but attract peak crowds and require early beach arrival for parking. May-June and September-October provide excellent conditions with comfortable temperatures, fewer crowds, and all facilities operational. Winter months (November-March) offer mild weather, perfect for walking, though water temperatures drop to 12-15°C. Local property owners typically enjoy the shoulder seasons most.

faqs.question: How accessible are these beaches for people with reduced mobility?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca South beaches lead in accessibility standards. Punta Prima features a wheelchair access lift to the beach. Most major beaches (La Mata, Los Locos, El Cura, La Zenia, Mil Palmeras, Torre de la Horadada) offer dedicated disabled facilities, wooden beach access ramps, accessible toilets, and parking spaces. Many have accessible showers and foot washing stations. The region actively accommodates accessibility needs, making beach visits feasible for all mobility levels.
